intro: Erodium asplenioides var. julianii, commonly known as Julian's erodium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to California. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, fern-like leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
